service_desc: The Krishak Bandhu Scheme caters to the farming community by means of assured continuous income and insurance coverage. The Krishak Bandhu Assured Income Scheme seeks to provide the farmers with a financial assistance of Rs. 10,000 per year (5,000 per acre in two instalments). Moreover, a one-time grant of Rs. 2 lakhs would be provided to the dependents of the farmers under the Krishak Bandhu Death Benefit Scheme (for which the farmers need not pay any premiums).
how_to_apply: The application process may be initiated by visiting the Agricultural Department of the West-Bengal. In the home page of the website, the ‘Krishak Bandhu’ tab must be opted. The user may now click on the ‘Sign In’ option. By clicking on the link suggested in the following page, the screen login window will be displayed on the screen. Now, the signup option must be clicked on, after which the user will be directed to the online registration form. The form may be submitted after specifying the required details. The application form must be supported with the attachment of the essential documents. The registration would be complete after the applicant submits the form. The username and password will be sent to the candidates, through which they can log in to the scheme and access its features.
eligibility_criteria: In the event of the death of any farmer or a recorded Bhagchasi (Share Cropper) in the age group of 18 – 60 years, the legal heir of the deceased will be eligible to get a one-time grant of Rs. 2,00,000/- (Rupees two lakhs only)

Only domiciliary (house/home) events within 21 days of the occurrence of the event may be reported. If the event has crossed the limit of 21 days, one must approach the office of the concerned registrar (B&D). c. To report a domiciliary event (within normal reporting period, i.e., 21 days), fill up the mandatory information to register yourself for reporting of an event through the following link. This login ID will work for a single birth/death event: crsorgi.gov.in/web/index.php/auth/signUp d. At the time of sign-up, users will be able to register for the functional registration units only, i.e., the registration units where this centralised application is being used for registration of births and deaths. From the drop-down list of registration units, the desired registration unit can be chosen e. After successful login, users need to fill the complete birth/death reporting form (both legal as well as statistical portion) to the best of their knowledge and belief. f. Get a print out of the application and forward it to the concerned registrar BY HAND at the given address (address will appear on the bottom of the print out of the application) along with the required documents.

how_to_apply: STEP 1:- Log On WBSEDCL Portal Home page: https://www.wbsedcl.in select tab Consumer Corner > Connection Management > Online application > New Connection (LT Others). STEP 2 :- Click on New User link > self Registration for new connection STEP 3:- Fill the details: Name & Mobile Number. Next click on Generate OTP Button. An OTP will be sent to the Mobile Number. Here Mobile Number will be consumers User Name. STEP 4:- Fill up the OTP & then click on Validate Button. STEP 5:- Next Email ID & Password need to be filled up. Next, Click on Generate OTP button. An OTP will be sent to e-mail id. Put the OTP and Click on the Validate button. STEP 6:- After validation password need to be created and then Click Submit button. After submission the user will be created & a successful message will be shown. The Login credentials will be mailed to the respective mail id also. STEP 7:- Next Go to Login Page via following path: Consumer Corner > Connection Management > Online application > New Connection (LT Others). Provide Username (mobile number) & Password to Login to New Connection application page. Consumer Need to Click Connection for Individual. STEP 8:- Fill the Region/District & Customer Care Center Name & Connection Type and then Click Next button STEP 9:- Fill the General Information Applicant can choose Consumer Type between below types: Normal Individual Owner (In this case, applicant needs to fill up details & click Validate button) Flat Owner in a Housing/Commercial Complex (In this case, applicant needs to select his/her Housing/Commercial Complex from Complex List which has already been registered with WBSEDCL. Then applicant needs to select type of residence under that complex & fill up related information. Then click Validate button.) STEP 10:- Applicant need to fill up Load Information & then click on Verify Load button. STEP 11:- After load verification, applicant can upload required documents along with a passport size photo. For the same he/she needs to click Yes button in the related message box. Then upload below documents: Passport size photo of applicant:[Photo should be in .jpg/.jpeg format within size of 100KB] Passport/Voter ID/Telephone Bill [Fill should be in PDF format within size of 150KB] Land ownership document (Property Paper/Purchase Deed/Tenancy Deed/Tax Receipt of Panchayat/Municipality/others )[ Fill should be in PDF format within size of 300 KB] STEP 12:- Next click Submit All Details button to submit the application details. STEP 13:- New Connection Applied Successfully message will be shown along with the application no. Note it Down. STEP 14:- Quotation can be downloaded from Download EMD/Quotation Letter tab & the clicking Generate Quotation button & then click Download Quotation Letter button. Applicant can also Download Booklet for New Connection by clicking the related link. Filled up New Connection Booklet can also be downloaded from the Download Booklet for New Connection Button STEP 15: Quotation amount can be paid online by going to New Connection E-Pay tab. Then clicking STEP 16: By clicking on Pay Now button will show the various online payment modes available. o Consumer need to select Payment Gateway o Check I Agree With Terms and Conditions checkbox. o Click Confirm button o Then click Proceed to Pay button. o STEP 17:- Consumers can also e-pay the quotation amount via RTGS/NEFT through Website of respective Bank. In this E-collection procedure, LT customers of WBSEDCL can pay their quotation amount. There will not be any requirement of preregistration on the part of customers they can pay the quotation amount in the Virtual Bank Account following the below mentioned logic o BANK A/C NO: WBQ<9 DIGIT CUSTOMER ID><APPLICATION NO> IFSC CODE: ICIC0000104  o BANK: CMS, Branch of ICICI Bank Ltd.  o The whole process is integrated with Bank’s system using web-service call procedure and the payment posting for successful transactions has been scheduled automatically. For the failed transactions the bank will return the amount to the respective accounts of the payees wherefrom the amount has been remitted.  o STEP 18:- After successful payment of the Quotation amount the payment receipt can be generated from Payment Receipt tab.  o STEP 19:- Then submit all the hard copies along with necessary documents at concerned Customer Care Centre

service_desc: Issue of recognition certificates to the tour operators & travel agents of West Bengal
how_to_apply:
"Applicant may apply online as per the prescribed format in e-District
platform"
eligibility_criteria:
"1. The applicant must have a capital of Rs. 1.00 lakh supported by the latest
audited balance sheet/Chartered Accountant’s certificate and the turnover
from the tour operations should be a minimum of Rs. 5.00 lakh.
2. The operator/agency should have been in operation for a minimum period of 2
years at the time of submission of application.
3.  The office of the operator/agency shall be located in neat and clean surroundings and shall be equipped with telephone, fax and computer reservation system etc. There shall be sufficient space for reception and easy access to toilets.
4.  The tour operator/agency shall be under the charge of a full time member of
their  staff who is adequately trained/experienced in matters regarding transport, accommodation, currency, customs regulations and general
information about travel and tourism related service.
5. The tour operator/agency shall have valid trade licence from local Municipality/Panchayat/Corporation.
6. The tour operator/agency shall have to be an income tax assesse and should have filed income-tax return up-to-date.
7.  The tour operator/agency should employ only Regional Guides and licensed by Government of India or Government of West Bengal."
required_doc:
"1. Applicant’s photo identity proof along with address (Voter card, Aadhar card,
Passport, Driving Licence).
2.  Photo identity proof along with address (Voter card, Aadhar card, Passport,
Driving License) of all partners/directors in case of partnership/private limited/
limited company.
3. Photo identity proof along with address (Voter card, Aadhar card, Passport,
Driving License) of all staffs.
4. Initial Trade License. 
5.  Last renewed Trade License.
6. Introductory letter from bank with which the tour operator/agency is having
current account. 
7.  Bank statement of last 6 months.
8. Audited Statements (balance sheet and profit & loss statement pertaining to
tour operation business) for the last 2 completed nancial years for the
calendar year immediately preceding the date of submission of the application.
9. Income Tax certificate of last 2 years.
10. Service Tax certificate of last 2 years. 
11.  Professional Tax certificate of last 2 years.
12. Detailed report of tours conducted/arranged during last 2 years.
13.  Rent Agreement and rent receipts of last 2 years or deed and tax receipts of last 2 years
14. Self-declaration and self-attestation of the applicant stating that the agency is
not convicted under any offence under any law of the land and declared
insolvent by competent Court. "

service_desc:
Street vendors represent a very important
constituent of the urban informal economy and
play a significant role in ensuring availability
of the goods and services at affordable rates
at the door-step of the city dwellers. They
are known as vendors, hawkers, thelewala,
rehriwala, theliphadwala etc. in different
areas/ contexts. The goods supplied by them
include vegetables, fruits, ready-to-eat street
food, tea, pakodas, breads, eggs, textile,
apparel, footwear, artisan products, books/
stationary etc. The services include barber
shops, cobblers, pan shops, laundry services
etc. The COVID-19 pandemic and consequent
lockdowns have adversely impacted the
livelihoods of street vendors. They usually
work with a small capital base and might have
consumed the same during the lockdown.
Therefore, there is an urgent need to provide
credit for working capital to street vendors to
resume their business.
